metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18888 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Symfony 2.8.0 through 2.8.50, 3.4.0 through3.4.34, 4.2.0 through 4.2.11, and 4.3.0 through 4.3.7. If an applicationpasses unvalidated user input as the file for which MIME type validationshould occur, then arbitrary arguments are passed to the underlying filecommand. This is related to symfony/http-foundation (and symfony/mime in4.3.x).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-asset - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1

criterions.comment: symfony package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
